Play:
The Battle of Coxinga
(Kokusen'ya kassen / 国性爺合戦)

Written By: Chikamatsu Monzaemon (近松門左衛門)

First Staged: 1715

Reference: Four Major Plays of Chikamatsu, translated by Donald Keene (New York: Columbia University Press, 1961); Hironaga, Shūzaburō, The Bunraku Handbook (Tokyo: Maison des Arts, 1976); Bunraku February 1980 Performance Program

– Click image to view.

Performances:

October 1973: The Battle of Coxinga

November 1973: The Battle of Coxinga

January 1978: The Battle of Coxinga

February 1980: The Battle of Coxinga

February 1982: The Battle of Coxinga

July 1984: The Battle of Coxinga

February 1986: The Battle of Coxinga

February 1996: The Battle of Coxinga

January 2002: The Battle of Coxinga

December 1992: The Battle of Coxinga

Characters:

Emperor Shisoretsu (Daimin Kōtei / 大明皇帝)

Ri Toten (Ugunshō Ri Tōten / 右軍将李蹈天)

Prince Bairoku (Shisha Bairokuō / 使者梅勒王)

Go Sankei (Shiba shōgun Gosankei / 司馬将軍呉三桂)

Princess Sendan (Sendan Kōjo / 栴檀皇女)

Ryukakun (Ryūkakun / 柳哥君)

An Taijin (An Taijin / 安大人)

Watonai (Watōnai / 和藤内)

Komutsu (Nyōbō Komutsu / 女房小むつ)

Ro Ikkan (Teishiryū Rō Ikkan / 鄭芝龍老一官)

Ro Ikkan's wife (Rō Ikkan tsuma / 老一官妻)

Kinshojo (Kinshōjo / 錦祥女)

Gojogun Kanki (Gojōgun Kanki / 五常軍甘輝)

Ladies-in-waiting (Koshimoto / 腰元)

Court ladies (Nyokan / 女官)

Beaters (Seko / 勢子)

Watonai's mother (Watōnai haha / 和藤内母)

Retainers (Gunpyō / 軍兵)
